name: Barcelo Costa Vasca

reviews.title: Get a high room!
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night. My advice;

Booking: My advice is get a room on a high floor. We were on the first floor and subjected to very loud music coming through the floor from the bar until 2am. Reception were unable to do anything about it. I've seen other reports of this on TripAdvisor, so I guess it's not uncommon.
reviews.title: Great Hotel to stay in

likes.liked: — How modern and clean it was
likes.disliked: — No shops near or in it

reviews.text: Rooms: When looking at the reviews on TripAdvisor, check the date they were written. The hotel had a major modernisation, which I think was in 2007, so a lot of the stuff about building works and outdated furnishings probably won't apply now. We had a fantastic, spacious room. Very stylish. Shame we couldn't get any sleep in it due to disco downstairs!!
reviews.title: Too far from the historic parts of San Sebastion...

likes.liked: — Room with a large terrace - but no view
likes.disliked: — Too far from town for someone without a car.

reviews.text: Location: It's a long but fairly pleasant walk into town, particularly if you want the old town which is the opposite side of the bay. Took us about 30 mins to get there. Easy to get to the hotel by road and taxi drivers know it. No sea view.
reviews.title: Rain in Spain falls mainly on Costa Vasca

likes.disliked: — No hot water & water dripping from ceiling into our room!

reviews.text: Parking: There are two car parks - the outdoor one out the front of the hotel or an underground one. As I understand it the underground one is cheaper if you're staying longer. The outdoor one was 15 euros overnight - but by the time we found that out we were already in it, and too late to change.
reviews.title: A bit far from the old part of town, which is where you'll spend your time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The previous reviews are mainly true - the hotel is deceivingly far from the Old Town of San Sebastian, which IS San Sebastian (google maps make it look pretty close to it all, but it's a one about a one mile walk from Old Town or a quick cab or public bus ride).
reviews.title: Spotless, modern hotel - a bit far from the "action"

reviews.text: If you can get over this (we burned off some greasy calories from all our pintxos hopping on the way in and out of town every night), you'll like it here. If you can't, stay along Concha beach. Being a city dweller, I'm used to a schlep once in a while. And after days in quaint hotels and little Penions, we were ready for a couple days of mid-scale luxury -- beautiful bathroom with a fantastic shower, air conditioned room, and a comfy bed.
reviews.title: Disappointing business motel feel - far from beach

reviews.text: The breakfast was worth the 13 Euro (all you can eat and drink - fresh squeezed juices, decent coffee, loads of hot and cold food items, fruits, soy milk, the works). The hotel doesn't look trendy from it's brick facade, but it looks newly renovated and feels the exact same.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for week of Donosti Cup 2009

reviews.text: We were touring Spain staying mainly in paradors and picked this hotel because it looked like a fun holiday hotel near the beach. It's not. It's in a residential area - blocks of apartments - with no restaurants, bars, or anything - nowhere near the old town. You can walk down to the beach - but you can't see it from the hotel - there are no views. My heart really sank when we drew up outside a massive carpark - which by the way costs a fortune to park in! We actually moved out of the hotel into another one because we were so disappointed. The swimming pool overlooks the car park and the road. It's basically a functional, average business type motel. The room looks big on the web - but it's not, it's small. Definitely not for kids or families or holiday.. We stayed in the Hotel Niza in the end - small and yes, a bit old fashioned, but elegant with pretty rooms and right on the beach so you can walk into the main town.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but less than ideal location

reviews.text: The outside decor of this hotel does nothing for the interior. A large group of us (30 boys aged 12) and 17 adults from Ireland stayed in this hotel for a week from July 4th 2009. Our U12 players were participating in the Soccer Tournament, Donosti Cup 2009. The hotel was perfect for our group, fantastic breakfast every morning before we headed off for our football matches. The pool was great for the lads to wind down every evening. The rooms were spacious, airy and spotless, cleaned daily. Staff were very friendly and helpful, having to deal with 30 lads every day! Very tasty cheese & ham toasties were the pick of the menu for the lads :-) The pool table came in very handy to keep the lads occupied the odd evening. I would defenitly reccommend this hotel for any team participating in the Donosti Cup next year and hopefully we will be back again.
reviews.title: Rates To Go/ Barcelo Costa Vasca

likes.disliked: — The noise of the mamouth rebuilding project continued in unsociable hours

reviews.title: Barcelo Costa Vasca - not for us!
reviews.text: Fortunately only stayed for two nights - one of the most expensive we stayed in on our two week trip and the least impressive! Not being able to find our booking on arrival wasn't so bad and was easily remedied. However room then booked was dull, dated and had building works going on around and noisy plumbing which kept us awake. We did complain and staff responded but not to make our stay any more enjoyable.

reviews.title: Enjoyable Experience
reviews.text: First the location. The hotel is about 500 metres from the beach, and up a hill in the old part of town. I found this great as it enabled me to work off those Poixtos (Tapas) that I kept eating. But also, because it off away from the usual haunts, you're not plagued by the bustle of more popular places.

We stayed Friday through Tuesday, and as one previous reviewer mentioned, there is a Disco on Friday and Saturday nights, but the noise didn't trouble us on the 2nd floor. The view was mixed - overlooking the street and resedential apartments opposite but this encouraged us to get out and about.
reviews.title: Do not stay here!

description: The Barceló Costa Vasca hotel**** is situated in the residential area of Ondarreta, in the city of San Sebastián, 300 metres from the beach of the same name and from the Palacio de Miramar gardens. The hotel has spacious and brightly designed rooms that will ensure a pleasurable rest. This 4-star hotel has an outdoor pool set within its garden and also boasts a fantastic health and wellness centre. At the hotel's restaurant Ulia, you will enjoy an extensive menu that ranges from Basque traditional food to nouvelle cuisine. The hotel has been awarded the Q Mark for Spanish Tourist Quality awarded by the Institute for Spanish Tourism Quality. Visit San Sebastián, land of beaches, hills and museums... the ideal place to practise your favourite sports and relax.
